title: Metabolic Exception Analysis: Why CV→Metabolic Works
finding: CV→Metabolic success is due to COMORBIDITY MANAGEMENT, not true repurposing

key_results.reason: Statins approved for CV risk reduction IN diabetic patients, not FOR diabetes
key_results.indication_text_evidence: All entries mention 'multiple risk factor intervention' for atherosclerotic disease

interpretation.explanation: Diabetes + dyslipidemia commonly co-occur. Statins treat dyslipidemia, not diabetes. The 'diabetes' indication is for CV prevention in diabetic patients, not glycemic control.

precision_implications.why_it_works: Disease comorbidity creates shared drug pools. Diabetic patients often need statins → statins appear in 'metabolic' disease GT.
precision_implications.is_this_good: Depends on use case. If goal is 'any approved drug for patient', yes. If goal is 'novel mechanism repurposing', no.
precision_implications.recommendation: For novel repurposing: distinguish primary mechanism from comorbidity management

data_quality_assessment.is_true_signal: Partially - reflects real clinical practice but not novel mechanism discovery
data_quality_assessment.action_needed: None - this is how drugs are actually used
